title: Cadbury's baffle fans by releasing their EASTER range in October
text:
Shoppers have already been complaining about festive products hitting the shelves as early as August, but Cadbury has taken preparation to the next level by announcing its Easter ranges ahead of Halloween and Christmas.

The chocolate company will be selling tubs of Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs next year, in a similar style to Christmas-time Roses or Quality Street.

A release date for the tins, which cost £5.99 for 319g - 409g of chocolates has not been revealed, but Cadbury say it will be early in the New Year.

However, it's caused a mixed reaction with some fans excited to hear about the treats, and others claiming it's far too early to be thinking about Easter 2020.

The chocolate company will be selling tubs of Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs next year, in a similar style to Christmas-time Roses or Quality Street

Taking to Facebook, chocolate enthusiasts were left confused by the sweet treats' early reveal, with one commenting: 'Let's wait for Christmas first.'

Another added: 'Not even Halloween and they're already advertising Easter!'

A third commented: 'All these goodies will soon be available all year round and nothing will be special anymore'.

However, others were clearly excited about the launch, and said they wished they would launch straight away.

The tins, which cost £5.99 for 319g - 409g of chocolatey goodness, have caused a mixed reaction with fans, some excited to the treat and some baffled that's it's been released so far out of season

Taking to Facebook, chocolate enthusiasts were left confused by the sweet treats early reveal.

'Shame they're not going to be available for Christmas, they would make a fortune, much better than Roses or Quality Street!' one said.

Another added: 'I reckon we could do these in one sitting'.

While a third wrote: 'OMG, I'm in trouble!'.

Cadbury's are also releasing a orange chocolate Bournville Easter egg

While others were clearly excited about the launch, hoping they'd arrive sooner

Cadbury is also releasing a orange chocolate Bournville Easter egg, an orange mousse flavour Peter Rabbit chocolate bar and a for coffee lovers, a Choca-Latte Easter egg.

The Peter Rabbit bar is 65p for a 30g bar, and the Bournville egg at 115g is £3.99, While the chocolate one is more indulgent at £9.99.

Cadbury has not said if the tubs contain full-size eggs or miniature eggs.
description: Cadbury has announced it will be selling tubs of Creme Eggs and Mini Eggs next year, as well as a new latte-flavoured Easter egg and orange mousse bunny, which will go on sale in early 2020.
